author: By Benet Wilson
title: 10 U.S. Airport Churches
text:
Back when I was a poor traveler, I just needed a quiet place at the airport far away from the masses. I didn’t have the money to spring for a restaurant or an airline lounge, which is how I stumbled on airport churches. Most of them are open 24 hours a day, seven days a week, and they are available for a quiet respite in between services. They can also offer spiritual comfort and other passenger needs. So below are links to 10 airport churches and the services they offer. And click here for a complete list of airport churches around the world , compiled by the International Association of Civil Aviation Chaplains.
1. Boston Logan International Airport Our Lady of the Airways Chapel is located at the International Tower between Terminals B and C at the airport. More »
2. Chicago O’Hare/Midway Airports Each chapel serves as a peaceful oasis in a busy airport where travelers can do silent prayer, as well as participate in worship and liturgies. Prayer books, rugs, Rosaries, worship materials and Juma' ablution (wudu) facilities are also available. More »
3. Cleveland-Hopkins International Airport The Interfaith Center is located on the secure side of the airport next to the Concourse B Security Checkpoint. It’s open Monday through Sunday, from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. More »
4. Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport The Interfaith Airport Chapel, open 24 hours a day, provides a sanctuary in the world's busiest airport, with chaplaincy services available throughout the week for the traveling public and airport employees with their spiritual needs. The chapel is available to all faiths for reading, meditation and prayer.
Domestic Terminal Atrium Chapel - Atrium Third Floor (outside security)
E-Chapel Councourse E - Top of escalator on right, behind the Martin Luther King Jr. exhibit.(inside security)
International Terminal F - Chapel Concourse F - Atrium Second Floor (inside security) More »
5. JFK Airport Our Lady of the Skies Catholic Chapel, located in Terminal 4, serves travelers, airline crews and airport employees when it comes to spiritual needs. The chapel is open daily between 6 a.m. and 10 p.m. Travelers are welcome to come and pray or just spend some time away from the terminal noise. More »
6. Lambert-St. Louis International Airport The chapel is open 24 hours a day, seven days a week for private prayer and meditation. It is located in the lower level of Terminal 1 closest to Exit Door 11. The chaplaincy holds on average 580 Protestant and Catholic services every year and also maintains prayer rugs for travelers of the Muslim faith. Daily Mass and weekend services are celebrated. More »
7. Newark-Liberty International Airport The airport has an Interfaith Chapel and Meditation Room in Terminal C between gates C70-99 and 101-115. More »
8. Orlando International Airport The airport has a chapel inside the terminal, located just beyond the west security checkpoint (Gates 1-59), which can be accessed by any passenger holding a boarding pass. More »
9. Phoenix-Sky Harbor International Airport The All-Faiths Chapel is on level 3 in Terminal 4. It is open to people of all faiths. It also hosts A.A. meetings at 12:15 p.m. every Friday in the chapel conference room More »
10. Pittsburgh International Airport The chapel is open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily for meditation and reflection. It is located at the Airside Terminal, Mezzanine Level. More »
